discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Notes because of the permission to read and write.

Selected Answer: B
Don't trust AI for every answer, but in this case it is correct.

B. MAC address spoofing
By spoofing the MAC address, the penetration tester can impersonate a legitimate device on the network, bypassing the NAC system's security mechanisms. This technique allows the tester to continue scanning and exploring the network without being immediately blocked.

questions.question_text: A penetration tester gained access to a customer’s internal corporate network via a wireless guest network. The penetration tester’s laptop was blocked by a NAC system after several Nmap scans. Which of the following techniques would be the most effective in evading the organization’s NAC system?

A penetration tester is performing an assessment for an organization and must gather valid user credentials. Which of the following attacks would be best for the tester to use to achieve this objective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B, only one that makes sense.

Selected Answer: B
Deauthentication does not gather credentials.

questions.question_text: A penetration tester would like to monitor the requests sent by Nikto with Burp Suite. Which of the following tools should the penetration tester use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. ProxyChains
ProxyChains can be configured to route Nikto's requests through Burp Suite, allowing the penetration tester to monitor and analyze the HTTP traffic.

questions.question_text: Which of the following approaches would be the most appropriate for a penetration tester who is doing a one-week timeboxed assessment for a large electronics retail business with hundreds of locations around the world?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This one is tough. On the one hand I would think testing virtually would allow them get more results, but on the other hand this would eliminate the physical aspect of the test. For a large electronics retail business I would think that physical penetration testing would be a priority for them. I am leaning toward B on this one.

choices.D: Testing on site for 50% of the retail locations
choices.A: Testing virtually with no on-site activities
choices.C: Testing on site for every retail location
choices.B: Testing on a limited sample of retail locations
